title.narrative: Enhancing the Capacity of Humanitarian Organisations in North East Nigeria

description.narrative: The Nigeria Joint Response (NJR) has requested CAFOD to support with providing Capacity Strengthening support to NJR two local partners. The capacity strengthening support is a step towards the Localization Agenda which aims to have the local partners at the forefront of humanitarian response as the first responders. CAFOD will facilitate a self-assessment for the NJRs two local partners. This assessment will be conducted over a period of three days for each partner. The assessment will be done in the partners’ field offices within Maiduguri, and it is expected that staff working in HR, Finance, Logistics, Program and the Leadership will fully participate. The capacity self-assessment is the starting point of an organisational change process. The capacity self-assessment process is not a training, an audit or external evaluation. It is therefore critical that the local organisation have a solid understanding and commitment to the self-assessment process and see this as the starting point of a longer capacity strengthening journey. CAFOD will provide support to the two organizations for a period of one month to develop their capacity strengthening plans including prioritization of capacity needs.
